The only core items on Vladimir are Hextech Revolver, the new Rylais because it's just broken af, Sorcerer Shoes and maybe Zhonyas. Always get Hextech Revolver first and upgrade it later after finishing your second item. After the change you can even consider not upgrading it until the enemy tanks got some MR. Rest should be built according to the situation. Good items are: Abyssal Scepter, Zhonyas, Rabadons, Void Staff, Ludens Echo is also somewhat okay and maybe an early Haunting Guise for the magic pen (sell it later though). I feel like the biggest noob traps are Spirit Visage (the thing offers no offensive stats and you're a mage after all, the 20% healing increase doesn't really make a difference, the 10% CDR isn't worth it, could be good if it was 20% and the HP > AP bonus from his passive is horrible while the AP > HP bonus is really good) and Liandrys (you don't even have real CC and that thing doesn't synergize as good with your kit as other things do, the only champs this item will ever be really good on are Rumble, Swain, Lissandra and maybe Zyra [tell me if i forgot someone]). I mean Liandries is not as horrible as building an Archangels Staff on him or something but there are just items that warrant an item slot more.

You mean picking up a % hp pen in the TANK META where tanks run with 3-4k hp so you're doing over 100 BONUS DAMAGE just from the % pen and not even counting the 300 hp (which gives you 8 ap admittedly not much but still something) and the 80 AP (which gives you 112 hp which is pretty decent) in stats. So, you get 88 AP 412 hp and 4% hp pen which with someone at 4k hp is an extra 160 dmg, that's pretty huge. Yes, not all teams have tanks so obviously this isn't a "CORE FOREVER" item. However, Vlad's items are pretty match-up based though.

Also, Spirit Visage as a "bad item"... really? So, you are trying to make a mage who has to get into the fights to do damage be completely a glass cannon with almost no tankiness. Really? So let's look at some numbers. Spirit Visage gives 400 hp, 10 ap (Vlad's passive) MR (we're looking at dmg here) 10% CDR and 20% increased healing from all sources. So, you now are healing for 18% of dmg dealt for all your spells instead of the normal 15% (because everyone grabs WotA). Ok, now let's look at the CDR portion. Your Q is a 4 second cd at max ranks, your W is 14 seconds, and E is 4.5 seconds. So, that 10% cdr is giving your Q a CD of 3.6, your W a cd of 12.6, and your E a cd of 4.05. Yes that's not insanely huge, however think about a team fight. You are able to get more rotations of your spells off due to the CDR and being able to SURVIVE through the dmg because you are more tanky. Also, you can HEAL for more so if you come out of that fight lower hp, you get more sustain off of minions through SV, AND you can have your pool up more to get out of sticky situations. Yes, you might get "more dmg" on each cast of your spells with your deathcap but with a .6 and .45 ap ratios are they worth it when your base damages are really good for a mage? I won't lie again, SV is a situational pick-up again, but by no means is it a noob-trap. It is a very good item on Vlad it's just there are so many other good items you have to build according to the team. 

So, idk what type of glass cannon vlad build you do, but by nature for Vlad to do damage he has to get a bit close to his targets and is pron to being focused so although you might have a higher upfront dmg build, if you die then how are you going to be doing damage? Also, since vlad is a versatile champion with his builds, sometimes he does have to be a "front-line" for his team so he will have to be tankier. You are underplaying the strength of simply being alive and taking punishment for your team where you should be a threat, but by taking the focus, your ADC (who should be pumping out dps) should be able to delete people as they can sit back and just wreck.

tl;dr: {{item:3151}}  and {{item:3065}}  are good items on Vlad and stating otherwise is stupid. However, they are situational  just like every other item that you pick up other than {{item:3152}}  due to the multiple ways to play vlad and to fit into a team comp correctly.

With troll pool and Zhonyas you are able to get your rotations off and still stay close to the enemy without being bursted down. And i repeat myself, building more AP results in gaining extreme amounts of health due to his passive. You should always take CDR blues on Vladimir expect against pokey AP matchups and that + WotA is all the CDR you need. Capping CDR is honestly overrated by many people on Vladimir, being able to deal 60% of the health of the enemy ADC/any other squishy alone with his ult proc because you built full offensive expect the semi-defensive items like Abyssal and Zhonyas is far better. You most likely won't get more than 2 spell rotations done before the teamfight is over. Why should i get a defensive item on a mage that can withstand focus for a long time and scales so incredibly well into lategame? I just can't understand that. If you need MR so bad because double AP comps or whatever, get an Abyssal Scepter. That thing also gives you HP thanks to Vlads passive. Why should i also act as a tank with a lategame-hypercarry now when my support, my jungle and my top lane if i play him mid are already tanks that soak up tons of damage? Just makes me cry when i see Vladimir players building Randuins and Spirit Visage and occasionally even Warmogs like they're Trinity Force bruisers. And one last thing: Can you please tell me how a build with 100 of each resistances if you've built Abyssal Scepter + Zhonyas and 3-4k HP is "glass cannon"? You seem to forget Vladimir gets defensive stats by building offensive while his passives HP > AP scaling is terrible.
And Liandries isn't necessarily a bad item, but there are just thousands of better options that synergize better with him, you already need a Wota, Sorc Shoes, Rylais is also too good since the update, Void Staff outclasses Liandries penetration if the enemy tanks stack MR, Abyssal Scepters aura also help other team members with magic damage, Zhonyas should be bought almost every game, the only thing that matters when to bought it, same for Rabadons.

First, what Vlad player ever builds {{item:3083}}  or even {{item:3143}} . The last time I have ever seen a Vlad build {{item:3083}}  is back in s2 when it gave you 1350 hp and then it was still not a great buy. Also, you fail to realize that Vlad is played in TOP LANE just as he is in mid. I mostly play him top, but when I do play him mid my build is different due to the lane matchups and different summoners I can take since I am not forced into {{summoner:12}}  to match my enemy. Also, you can't zhonyas/troll pool in stuns or silences. So, if you are going full ap and working simply on your "hp from passive" and "OMG I HAVE LOTS OF RESISTS FROM 2 ITEMS!!!" then you will simply be melted by any AD carry or mage. News flash, 100 armor is almost achievable for most champions simply with runes, masteries, and being lvl 18. It's not much and any AD carry with as many items as you will eat you alive for breakfast, and you have to get close enough to touch that AD carry with no dashes so you're probably going to be walking by Mr. Tank if the AD carry has any brains who will cc you and then you will be shreded because with normal pen your 100 armor is really only 65 armor (thanks LW+masteries). So, you might be able to "kill" an AD carry with 2 rotations but with your build that is 4 seconds to do. Even if you zhonyas or troll pool that's only half the time, so unless the AD carry is off in no man's land they'll be healing via lifesteal. So, maybe full AP vlad can work, but still you have to be adaptive with your play and builds and it seems like you have a cookie-cutter build for every team and that's how you lose games. If you want an example of cookie-cutter builds failing look at the TSM vs GV game. The shout casters kept commenting that TSM really needed to adapt their build paths to the game itself and stop going cookie-cutter builds because it wasn't going to work vs the enemy team and if that had made better decisions in items like AS boots over magic pen on Corki since he needed to AA more since the enemy team was stacking lots of MR they would have done a lot better. 

tl;dr: Vlad is amazing because of his adaptive build paths. If you refuse to realize that people play vlad top along with mid and sometimes you have carry tops (Riven) and refuse to adapt your build for each game then you will lose due to ignorance and stubbornness.

I feel like they are nerfing the wrong thing. He's supposed to be a hypercarry, meaning his late game should be really strong, but they are nerfing the amount of damage he does as he ranks up his abilities. 

They are forgetting that he is also a lane bully, and should be putting the nerfs mostly on the early ranks of his abilities to actually make his early game weak. 

Yea I suppose he's weak against high burst mages, but those types of champions top lane are bad in an overall team composition. Meanwhile, Vlad get's tanky and has sustained damage to compliment a team comp well. 

Even tho i hate the whole "Make it a skillshot!" mentality, targeted, mana-free, ranged sustain shouldn't exist in the game, and makes his kit insanely difficult to balance, as well as making it no fun to play against, especially if you're a melee tank w/out burst. 

That being said, any nerf to a broken (gameplay wise) champ is still applauded by me. But please, for the love of God, fix is toxic kit.
